A: The study of the ways people organize themselves, how laws, rules and regulations are designed and followed for the progress of the society is referred to as _ (a) Physical Education (b) Health Education (c) Civic Education
Free and fair election means that there should be no cheating (a) True (b) False
One of these is a condition for Nationality (a) Respect (b) Politics (c) Birth
All these, Except _ are the components of Civic Education (a) Nationality (b) Rights and duties (c) Dressing
The collective name for father and mother is _ (a) Mum and Dad (b) Brethren (c) Parents
The collective name for brother and sister is _ (a) Brosis (b) Siblings (c) Bros
The family as the basic unit of the society helps to promote the interest of the members (a) True (b) False
Who are considered siblings? (a) People who work together (b) Members of polygamous family (c) People belonging to the same parents
Assisting in a child's upbringing is a role of extended family (a) True (b) False
Democracy allows people to _ (a) Only vote in election (b) Respect the national symbols (c) Freely choose their leaders and contribute to the political, social and economic activities
What is the primary purpose of marriage? (a) To keep our surrounding clean (b) To form a family (c) To join politics
Why should we take care of government property? (a) Because it is important to the government (b) Because it is expensive (c) Because it belongs to everyone
Nigeria's former National Anthem, adopted at independence in 1960, titled "Nigeria we hail thee" was written by who? (a) Mary's lessor (b) Miss Florida show (c) Lillian Jean Williams
One of these is not a way to show patriotism (a) Disrespecting the law of the land (b) Performing our civic responsibilities (c) Serving our nation anyway we can
The strong feeling of love for, and pride in, one's nation is known as _ (a) Enthusiasm (b) Patriotism (c) Hospitality
One of the reasons for patriotism is to promote unity (a) True (b) False
We show patriotism by practicing loyalty and shunning all actions likely to damage the interest of our country (a) True (b) False
Those things which every citizen expects from a state as a legal member of that state is called _ (a) Duties (b) Freedom (c) Right
One of these is a condition for Nationality (a) Naturalization (b) Home training (c) Respect

Duties (also called obligations and responsibilities) refer to those things that _ (a) Are expected of every citizen as a legal member of any state (b) Makes the government great (c) We practice as business procedures

A collective name that describes individuals, groups, institutions and organizations with legitimate (legal) powers to perform certain functions for the benefit of the society is known as _ (a) Religion (b) Constituted authority (c) Nationality
The Nigerian national flag is a simple design of green-white-green The green represents _ (a) The strength of Nigeria (b) Peace and Unity (c) The rich fertile soil of Nigeria
The white color of the Nigerian national flag stands for _ (a) Peace (b) Progress (c) Agriculture
In the colonial period, the British flag, known as the _ was Nigeria's flag (a) Coats (b) Union Jack (c) Arms
Constitution is another important symbol of Nigeria because it guides government activities and safeguards human rights (a) True (b) False
The Nigeria coat of arms was designed by a young talented Nigerian lady (a) True (b) False
When citizens are are patriotic, there would be respect for law and order (a) True (b) False
One of these is not an example of constitutional authority (a) Parents (b) Teachers (c) Electricians
Performing our civic obligations is our responsibilities to constituted authorities (a) True (b) False
_ are normally used to cure illness but they can also be abused for other purposes (a) Drugs (b) Cowries (c) Chemicals
